channel.title: How to add invisible command for admins?
channel.description:
So they can be invisible while checking on the people around the world
how would i do this?
thanks for looking.
edit - I tryed doing with amour and failed.

item.title: How to add invisible command for admins?
item.dc:creator: @Zilent Zilent
item.description:
@Zilent wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:6, topic:328821”]EZ

go into the player position & player appearance packet builder, do a if(player.isMod() && player.isInvisible()) {
// dont send appearance/position data for the admin to the players client
}

of course you’d need your own isInvisible method & command to enable it etc, u get the point[/quote]

You will also need to adjust the update size, so the client won’t try to read out of the data array’s upper bound.

Read full topic
item.source: How to add invisible command for admins?

item.title: How to add invisible command for admins?
item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

I was amazed by Frank’s server. Always pointed one direction when you stopped walking though. Jagex even made a teasing remark about it in one of their news posts about how some people were trying and failing (couldn’t even get walking right!) to make private servers. They took down the news article months later to save face though.

Read full topic
item.source: How to add invisible command for admins?

item.title: How to add invisible command for admins?
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“darscape, post:7, topic:328821”]One time I was in the deep wilderness on RSC before they created the members side of it during a PK trip with my clan. (This was around 2002)

We encountered a white dot on the map so we approached to attack it. When we arrived, it was a random player at a random combat level. (I don’t remember the name or level but it was average) What was odd was that we could not right click attack him. He walked around in a pattern similar to that of a NPC too. He never spoke nor replied with trade requests. A minute later he logged out. Was it a Jagex mod? Was it a zone glitch? (Similar to what was seen in RSCDEF/Geminus/Glass Dagger when players could walk off the map and reappear in the opposite direction despite being located in another area)[/quote]

ohhh i remember when glass dagger, and geminus was released, there were sooooo many bugs, brings back memories

Read full topic
item.source: How to add invisible command for admins?

item.title: How to add invisible command for admins?
item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

One time I was in the deep wilderness on RSC before they created the members side of it during a PK trip with my clan. (This was around 2002)

We encountered a white dot on the map so we approached to attack it. When we arrived, it was a random player at a random combat level. (I don’t remember the name or level but it was average) What was odd was that we could not right click attack him. He walked around in a pattern similar to that of a NPC too. He never spoke nor replied with trade requests. A minute later he logged out. Was it a Jagex mod? Was it a zone glitch? (Similar to what was seen in RSCDEF/Geminus/Glass Dagger when players could walk off the map and reappear in the opposite direction despite being located in another area)

Read full topic
item.source: How to add invisible command for admins?

item.title: How to add invisible command for admins?
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

EZ

go into the player position & player appearance packet builder, do a if(player.isMod() && player.isInvisible()) {
// dont send appearance/position data for the admin to the players client
}

of course you’d need your own isInvisible method & command to enable it etc, u get the point

Read full topic

item.title: How to add invisible command for admins?
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Ha, I’ve never thought of doing it like that but that’s really tacky. I’d be interested to know what people have done though, there’s so many ways to achieve the same thing but some not as good as the others.

True. Some ways will work better than others, some may not. Also, there’ll be quite a few things that need editing to make it 100% perfect.

Read full topic

create a set of armor that uses a sprite (itemwieldable) which is not currently defined
